alert.note: Alert for Atlantic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Atlantic County through 330 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mizpah, or 10 miles east of Vineland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hammonton, Egg Harbor City, Weymouth, Estell Manor, Port Republic, Dorothy, Mays Landing, Elwood-Magnolia, Mizpah, Pomona and Folsom. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 44 and 45. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 11 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
